title.native: 東京リベンジャーズ 聖夜決戦編

description:
Despite his best time-leaping efforts, Takemichi Hanagaki continuously fails to prevent the present-day death of Hinata Tachibana, his adolescent love. The adult Takemichi grapples with grief and the ramifications of the Tokyo Manji gang's criminal empire—an unintended product of his timeline meddling. Though the gang once operated under the idealistic Manjirou "Mikey" Sano, it has now been taken over by the malicious Tetta Kisaki and, as a result, has abandoned its original optimistic intent.

Despite feeling hopeless, Takemichi travels to the past once again to investigate Black Dragon, a rival motorcycle gang whose actions ultimately lead to Hinata's demise. There, he meets the young Hakkai Shiba, a fellow gang member whose older brother, Taiju, tyrannically rules Black Dragon.

Takemichi, with Chifuyu on his side, works to unravel the fates of Black Dragon's members, fighting to create a happy future for his loved ones.

(Source: MAL Rewrite, edited)

tags.name: Revenge

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.description: Prominently features a character that is homeless.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

alternative: Vice-Leader of The Tokyo 卍 Gang

node.description: Received a Young Magazine Newcomer Manga Award Honorable Mention for his _Shinjuku Swan_ one-shot in 2004.
**Hatsumi Kouichi** is a Japanese director, character designer, animation director, episode director and storyboard artist.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TUYU_official) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCB2tP2QfRG7hTra0KTOtTBg)__

__Introduction:__
Tuyu is a Japanese music unit consisting of four members: a guitarist and music producer, a vocalist, an animator; who also works as an illustrator, and a pianist. They are under their own independent music label named TUYU (2020–).

__Biography:__
Pusu, a vocalist and music producer who had recently resigned as a vocalist, would go on to [tweet](https://twitter.com/Pusu_kun/status/1138416098997460993) on June 11, 2019 that he was working on a new original song in addition to working on "new things".

A day later, it was revealed through a tweet by Pusu, which linked to a YouTube video on his now rebranded channel, that the original song he had been working on wasn't a solo project, and that it was titled "TUYU - やっぱり雨は降るんだね", indicating that the "new things" might be a new band. On the same day, about 35 minutes later, a [tweet](https://twitter.com/TUYU_official/status/1138771878766448641) by a new twitter account named TUYU_official was retweeted by Pusu, which officially announced the formation of the music unit Tuyu.

Their first upload as a band was the song _Yappari Ame wa Furunda ne_, which was uploaded on June 12, 2019, with the same name being used for their first album released later on February 19, 2020. All of their music videos up until _[Kako ni Torawarete Iru](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lGFEqEFJ410)_, have been animated by AzyuN, featuring art by Omutatsu.

On May 31, 2024, composer Pusu was arrested in Tokyo after an attempted murder of his girlfriend. This led to the disbandment of the group, announced on June 8, 2024 via a [tweet](https://x.com/TUYU_official/status/1799380850414330008).

__Members:__
- [Pusu](https://anilist.co/staff/186915) (ぷす) – guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition

__Former Members:__
- [Rei](https://anilist.co/staff/186920/Rei) (礼衣) – vocalist
- AzyuN – animator and illustrator
- [miro](https://anilist.co/staff/186918/Miro) – pianist
- [Omutatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/148987/Koto-Tatsui) (おむたつ), also known as Koto Tatsui (たついこと) – illustrator and designer

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Satoshi Fujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/277082) (藤原聡) - born August 19, 1991 (lead vocals, piano)
• Daisuke Ozasa (小笹大輔) - born January 6, 1994 (lead guitar, backing vocals)
• Makoto Narazaki (楢﨑誠) - born March 18, 1989 (bass, saxophone, backing vocals)
• Masaki Matsuura (松浦匡希) - born January 22, 1993 (drums, percussion, backing vocals)
